info.title: Oxide Region API
info.description: API for interacting with the Oxide control plane

get.description: Returns a list of racks. The racks are returned sorted by name alphabetically.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

get.description: Returns details of the specified rack.

parameters.name: rack_id
parameters.description: The rack's unique ID.

get.description: Returns a list of sleds. The sleds are returned sorted by name alphabetically.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

get.description: Returns details of the specified sled.

parameters.name: sled_id
parameters.description: The sled's unique ID.

get.description:
Returns a list of all organizations in the system. The organizations are returned in sorted order, with the most recent organizations appearing first.
TODO: figure out if the above is correct or what the order actually is.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

get.description: Retrieves the details of an organization with the given name. The same information is returned when creating or updating an organization.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

put.description: Updates the specified organization by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an organization. It cannot be undone. This will not remove any users or groups since those are being synced from your identity provider via SCIM or SAML authentication.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

get.description: Returns a list of all projects in the organization. This includes only the subset of projects that the caller has access to. The projects are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created projects appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

post.description: Creates a new project in the specified organization.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

get.description: Returns the project with the specified name in the specified organization.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

put.description: Updates the specified project in the specified organization by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided are left unchanged.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

delete.description: Permanently deletes the project with the specified name in the specified organization. It cannot be undone. This also deletes all the project's resources.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

get.description: Returns a list of disks in the specified project. The disks are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created disks appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

post.description: Creates a new disk in the specified project.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

get.description: Retrieves the details of the disk with the specified name in the specified project.

delete.description: Permanently deletes the disk with the specified name in the specified project. This cannot be undone.

get.description: Retrieves a list of instances in the specified project. The instances are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created instances appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

post.description: Creates a new instance in the specified project.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

get.description: Retrieves the instance with the specified name in the specified project and organization.

delete.description: Permanently deletes the instance with the specified name in the specified project and organization. This operation cannot be undone. If the instance is using a disk, and the disk settings are to delete upon instance deletion, the disk will be deleted. Any ephermal IP addresses associated with the instance will be released.

get.description: List the disks attached to a specified instance. The disks are listed in alphabetical order by name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

post.description: Attaches a disk to a specified instance. You must first create the disk before you can attach it to an instance. TODO: link to that API call. It is not possible to create and attach a disk from one API call.
Detaches a disk from a specified instance. The disk is not deleted, but it is no longer attached to the instance.
Migrates an instance to a different propolis server, possibly on a different sled.

get.description: List the network interfaces attached to a specified instance. The network interfaces are listed in alphabetical order by name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

post.description: Create a network interface for a specified instance.

get.description: Retrieve a specific network interface attached to a specified instance.

delete.description: Detaches a network interface from a specified instance. The network interface is not deleted, but it is no longer attached to the instance.

post.description: Reboots the instance with the specified name in the specified project and organization. Any ephermal IP addresses associated with the instance will be released and a new ephermal IP address will be assigned when the instance starts back up. If you want the IP address to remain consistent, change it to a floating IP address before rebooting. TODO: link to that API call.
Starts the instance with the specified name in the specified project and organization.

Stop the instance with the specified name in the specified project and organization. Any ephermal IP addresses associated with the instance will be released and a new ephermal IP address will be assigned when the instance starts back up. If you want the IP address to remain consistent, change it to a floating IP address before stopping. TODO: link to that API call.

get.description: List snapshots in a project. Snapshots are sorted by creation time, with the most recently created snapshots appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

post.description: Create a snapshot of a disk.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific snapshot in a project.

delete.description: Permanently delete a snapshot from a project. This operation cannot be undone.

get.description: Returns a list of VPCs in the specified project. The VPCs are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created VPCs appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

post.description: Create a new VPC in a project.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The organization's unique name.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project's unique name within the organization.

get.description: Retrieve details about a specific VPC in a project.

put.description: Updates the specified VPC in a project by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

delete.description: Permanently delete a VPC from a project. This operation cannot be undone. Any subnets or other resources in the VPC will be deleted as well.

get.description: Returns a list of firewall rules in a VPC. The firewall rules are returned sorted alphabetically by name.

put.description: Replaces the firewall rules in a VPC with the specified rules. Any existing firewall rules are overwritten by the new rules. TODO: write a bit about the semantics of this operation since it is finiky.

get.description: Returns a list of routers in a VPC. The routers are returned sorted alphabetically by name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

post.description: Creates a new router in a VPC.

get.description: Returns details of the router with the specified name.

put.description: Updates the specified router by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not specified are left unchanged.

delete.description: Deletes the router with the specified name. This operation cannot be undone.

get.description: Returns a list of routes for the specified router. The routes are returned in alphabetical order by route name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

post.description: Creates a new route in the specified router.

get.description: Returns details of the route with the specified name in the specified router.

put.description: Updates the specified route in the specified router by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided are left unchanged.

delete.description: Permanently deletes the specified route from the specified router. TODO: We might want some more detail here on the behavior of this endpoint.

get.description: Returns a list of all subnets in a VPC. The subnets are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created subnet appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

post.description: Creates a new subnet in a VPC.

get.description: Returns the specified subnet in a VPC.

put.description: Updates the specified subnet in a VPC by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided are left unchanged.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a subnet from a VPC. This operation cannot be undone.

get.description: Returns details of the specified user. If you pass `me` as the `user_name`, this function returns details of the authenticated user. TODO: Can we make the above true.

parameters.name: user_name
parameters.description: The built-in user's unique name.

ByteCount.description:
A count of bytes, typically used either for memory or storage capacity

The maximum supported byte count is [`i64::MAX`].  This makes it somewhat inconvenient to define constructors: a u32 constructor can be infallible, but an i64 constructor can fail (if the value is negative) and a u64 constructor can fail (if the value is larger than i64::MAX).  We provide all of these for consumers' convenience.

RouteDestination.description:
A `RouteDestination` is used to match traffic with a routing rule, on the destination of that traffic.

When traffic is to be sent to a destination that is within a given `RouteDestination`, the corresponding [`RouterRoute`] applies, and traffic will be forward to the [`RouteTarget`] for that rule.

oneOf.description: Route applies to traffic destined for a specific IP address
Route applies to traffic destined for a specific IP subnet
Route applies to traffic destined for the given VPC.
Route applies to traffic

RouteTarget.description: A `RouteTarget` describes the possible locations that traffic matching a route destination can be sent.

oneOf.description: Forward traffic to a particular IP address.
Forward traffic to a VPC
Forward traffic to a VPC Subnet
Forward traffic to a specific instance
Forward traffic to an internet gateway

RouterRoute.description: A route defines a rule that governs where traffic should be sent based on its destination.

router_id.description: The VPC Router to which the route belongs.

time_modified.description: timestamp when this resource was last modified

RouterRouteKind.description:
The classification of a [`RouterRoute`] as defined by the system. The kind determines certain attributes such as if the route is modifiable and describes how or where the route was created.

See [RFD-21](https://rfd.shared.oxide.computer/rfd/0021#concept-router) for more context

ipv6_prefix.description:
The IPv6 prefix for this VPC.

All IPv6 subnets created from this VPC must be taken from this range, which sould be a Unique Local Address in the range `fd00::/48`. The default VPC Subnet will have the first `/64` range from this prefix.

direction.description: whether this rule is for incoming or outgoing traffic

filters.description: reductions on the scope of the rule

VpcFirewallRuleFilter.description: Filter for a firewall rule. A given packet must match every field that is present for the rule to apply to it. A packet matches a field if any entry in that field matches the packet.

hosts.description: If present, the sources (if incoming) or destinations (if outgoing) this rule applies to.

ports.description: If present, the destination ports this rule applies to.

protocols.description: If present, the networking protocols this rule applies to.

VpcFirewallRuleHostFilter.description: The `VpcFirewallRuleHostFilter` is used to filter traffic on the basis of its source or destination host.

oneOf.description: The rule applies to traffic from/to all instances in the VPC
The rule applies to traffic from/to all instances in the VPC Subnet
The rule applies to traffic from/to this specific instance
The rule applies to traffic from/to a specific IP address
The rule applies to traffic from/to a specific IP subnet

VpcFirewallRuleProtocol.description: The protocols that may be specified in a firewall rule's filter

VpcFirewallRuleTarget.description: A `VpcFirewallRuleTarget` is used to specify the set of [`Instance`]s to which a firewall rule applies.

oneOf.description: The rule applies to all instances in the VPC
The rule applies to all instances in the VPC Subnet
The rule applies to this specific instance
The rule applies to a specific IP address
The rule applies to a specific IP subnet

targets.description: list of sets of instances that the rule applies to

VpcSubnet.description: A VPC subnet represents a logical grouping for instances that allows network traffic between them, within a IPv4 subnetwork or optionall an IPv6 subnetwork.

description.description: human-readable free-form text about a resource

id.description: unique, immutable, system-controlled identifier for each resource

name.description: unique, mutable, user-controlled identifier for each resource

time_created.description: timestamp when this resource was created

time_modified.description: timestamp when this resource was last modified

vpc_id.description: The VPC to which the subnet belongs.

ipv4_block.description:
The IPv4 address range for this subnet.

It must be allocated from an RFC 1918 private address range, and must not overlap with any other existing subnet in the VPC.

ipv6_block.description:
The IPv6 address range for this subnet.

It must be allocated from the RFC 4193 Unique Local Address range, with the prefix equal to the parent VPC's prefix. A random `/64` block will be assigned if one is not provided. It must not overlap with any existing subnet in the VPC.

IdSortMode.description:
Supported set of sort modes for scanning by id only.

Currently, we only support scanning in ascending order.

NameOrIdSortMode.description: Supported set of sort modes for scanning by name or id

NameSortMode.description:
Supported set of sort modes for scanning by name only

Currently, we only support scanning in ascending order.

tags.name: disks
tags.description: Virtual disks are used to store instance-local data which includes the operating system.

tags.name: firewall
tags.description: Firewall operation controls the flow of network data into a VPC

tags.name: hidden
tags.description: TODO operations that will not ship to customers

tags.name: instances
tags.description: Virtual machine instances are the basic unit of computation. These operations are used for provisioning, controlling, and destroying instances.

tags.name: metrics
tags.description: Metrics provide insight into the operation of the Oxide deployment. These include telemetry on hardware and software components that can be used to understand the current state as well as to diagnose issues.

tags.name: organizations
tags.description: Organizations represent a subset of users and projects in an Oxide deployment.

tags.name: projects
tags.description: Projects are a grouping of associated resources such as instances and disks within an organization for purposes of billing and access control.

tags.name: racks
tags.description: These operations pertain to hardware inventory and management. Racks are the unit of expansion of an Oxide deployment. Racks are in turn composed of sleds, switches, power supplies, and a cabled backplane.

tags.name: roles
tags.description: Roles are a component of Identity and Access Management (IAM) that allow a user or agent account access to additional permissions.

tags.name: routers
tags.description: Routers direct the flow of network traffic into, out of, and within a VPC via routes.

tags.name: sagas
tags.description: Sagas are the abstraction used to represent multi-step operations within the Oxide deployment. These operations can be used to query saga status and report errors.

tags.name: sleds
tags.description: This tag should be moved into hardware

tags.name: snapshots
tags.description: Snapshots of Virtual Disks at a particular point in time.

tags.name: subnets
tags.description: This tag should be moved into a generic network tag

tags.name: updates
tags.description: This tag should be moved into a operations tag

tags.name: users
tags.description: This tag should be moved into an IAM tag

tags.name: vpcs
tags.description: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is an isolated network environment that should probaby be moved into a more generic networking tag
